home.title: Plan your Empire.
home.subtitle: Rule the Prosperous Universe.
home.description: Say goodbye to complex spreadsheets and easily manage your game assets.
home.features_subtitle: Optimize your planning and resource management to ensure you stay ahead in the galaxy.

features.base_simulation_desc: PRUNplanner lets you design and experiment with new bases without spending in-game resources. It simulates every aspect of a base, from habitation and production buildings to COGC projects and planetary resources.
features.empire_planning_desc: Easily organize and manage your entire empire. With PRUNplanner, you can plan across multiple bases and complex supply chains, ensuring your material flow is on schedule and your empire runs smoothly.
features.game_data_desc: Stay ahead with up-to-date market information integrated directly from the community API (FIO). Make informed decisions on planning and expansion based on real markets and optimal ROI.
features.burn_repair_desc: Prevent shortages and bottlenecks with detailed management tools. PRUNplanner tracks your resources and consumables, ensuring you have everything you need when you need it to keep operations seamless.
features.market_exploration_desc: Explore historical market trends over the past few years to reveal the true behavior of the market. Discover exciting opportunities and calculate ROI for every recipe and resource effortlessly—providing you with the strategic edge needed for smarter planning.
features.additional_tools_desc: Explore material prices from now back several years, understand the optimal time to repair production buildings, monitor expert refreshes, and optimize habitation buildings for minimum area or cost. PRUNplanner provides all these features and more.

home.command_anywhere_title: Take Command of Your Empire from Anywhere
home.command_anywhere_subtitle: Monitor bases, manage production, and keep control of your plans with ease. With intuitive and powerful tools, you can strategize, expand, and outmaneuver your rivals, no matter where you are.

screenshots.empire: Empire: Track production, supply chains, and growth across all your planets.
screenshots.plan: Plan: Strategize and analyze without spending in-game resources.
screenshots.management: Management: Effortlessly coordinate plans, expansions, and your next moves.
screenshots.exchanges: Exchanges: Optimize in-game pricing and trading strategies.
screenshots.exploration: Exploration: Analyze years of market data for smarter insights.
screenshots.search: Search: Instantly find the precise planets and resources you need.

home.core_concepts_subtitle: PRUNplanner is comprised of three main components, allowing you to plan and manage your Prosperous Universe empire.

concepts.plans_desc: Plans are at the heart of your operations in PRUNplanner. They contain all the buildings, production, and bonuses you can place in Prosperous Universe. You create new plans by searching for planets where you want to create a base. Furthermore, a plan should be assigned an exchange preference and assigned to an empire.
concepts.empires_desc: Empires are a collection of plans (e.g. all the bases you currently have settled in Prosperous Universe, or those you want to settle, all interrelated). Each empire acts like a container for multiple plans. Furthermore, each empire can be assigned an exchange preference.
concepts.exchanges_desc: The exchange settings allow you to define market preferences for material pricing. Each preference can be used for multiple empires. However, each empire can only be assigned one exchange preference. This ensures all individual plans being part of an empire have their prices calculated correctly.

home.open_source_desc: PRUNplanner is completely free to use and its frontend is entirely open source. Love it? We'd appreciate it if you could contribute!
home.made_with: Made with heart in Munich and contributions from around the globe.

actions.must_set_name: Must set plan name in configuration to save

plan.leave_confirmation: Are you sure you want to leave? Unsaved changes will be lost.

supply_cart_details.title: Supply Cart
supply_cart_details.info_text: The Supply Cart provides updates on your plans needs combined with existing inventory sourced from FIO. You have the flexibility to opt for alternative storage locations to replenish your base. Tailor your selection based on whether you wish to restock workforce and production supplies or focus on a specific category, and specify the duration for which the supplied stock should sustain.
supply_cart_details.fio_burn_link: Use the FIO Burn tool for more advanced supply cart options.

visitation_frequency_details.title: Visitation Frequency
visitation_frequency_details.storage_info: Your plan involves adding {sto} STO, giving you a total storage capacity of {total}.
visitation_frequency_details.exclusion_info: Exclude local materials from visitation frequency calculation for items handled exclusively planet-side, like local market sales, purchases or contracts.

popr_details.title: Latest Population Report
popr_details.error_loading: Error loading latest population report. The planet might not have any population.

infrastructure.auto_optimize_tip: Automatically optimize habitation to match workforce needs when adding buildings.

experts.max_warning: The maximum amount of base experts is 6. You currently have {amount} experts assigned.

bonuses.corp_hq_tip: The corporation you belong to has its headquarters on this planet (not your individual company).

info.revenue_day: Revenue / Day is calculated by taking the daily income generated from a recipe and subtracting both the daily workforce cost (all luxuries provided) and the daily building degradation cost (1/180th of the construction cost). The income from the recipe is based on the difference between the input material costs and the output material values.
info.dollar_area: $ / Area is the daily revenue divided by the area for one production building and its proportionate share of the area for a CM and habs required for an optimal base of such buildings in Recipe ROI.
info.roi_payback: ROI (Payback) is the time required for a continuously operating recipe to generate enough revenue to offset the building's construction cost. This considers daily degradation and workforce costs as well.

burn.title: FIO Burn
burn.description: The FIO Burn tool provides comprehensive data on the current net consumption of materials in your storage caused by workforce consumption and production. This information is sourced from the FIO system.
burn.calculating: One does not simply calculate automate burn supply.

repair.title: FIO Repair
repair.description: The FIO Repair tool integrates building condition data from FIO to forecast repair needs across all your bases. With this tool, you can effectively plan and manage repairs resulting from building degradation.

basic.heading: Planet Name or ID
basic.search_info: Search must include at least 3 characters. Example Searches: "OT-580b", "Montem", "OT-" or "580".

results.heading: Search Results
results.no_results: No results found for your search

production_chain.title: Production Chains
production_chain.terminals_help: Terminals are materials whose inputs are excluded from the graph, useful if you buy them on the CX or locally and don't need to produce them.

market_exploration.title: Market Exploration
market_exploration.select_hint: Please select an Exchange and Material. Press "Explore".

resource_roi.title: Resource ROI Overview
resource_roi.initial_hint: Select a Resource and press "Search & Calculate"
resource_roi.searching_planets: Searching for planets with {material}. Awaiting backend response.

empire.no_empires_text: You do not have any empires yet. Head over to the management page to create your first empire.
empire.calculating: Empire plans are being calculated, please wait.

plan_list.assign_plans: Assign existing plans in the management page or create new plans via the planet search.

preferences.title: Preferences
preferences.description: Your preferences are saved locally in your browser and aren't synced with the backend yet. Use this panel to review and customize your PRUNplanner settings.
preferences.plan_settings_description: These settings are managed within individual plans. This section provides an overview of the preferences you've customized so far — to modify them, navigate to the corresponding plan.

storage.title: Browser Storage
storage.description: PRUNplanner minimizes API calls by storing data locally in your browser. Data refreshes automatically at set intervals.

change_profile.title: Profile
change_profile.description: FIO Data Updates are handled by PRUNplanners backend automatically. It is not required to provide an email but highly recommended for increased account safety and password recovery.

change_password.title: Change Password
change_password.description: Passwords must be at least 8 characters long.

api.title: API
api.description: PRUNplanner utilizes its own backend API to securely store and interact with data, including both game data from FIO and data generated by users during base and empire planning. Through easy-to-use CSV endpoints, you can access and process this data in spreadsheets or other applications of your choice. Access to the API requires an API Key for secure authentication, distinct from your FIO API Key. Note that FIO remains the essential source of all Prosperous Universe in-game data, while PRUNplanner serves as a powerful supplement for your planning needs.

management.title: API Keys
management.limit_reached: You're allowed up to 5 API Keys.

exchange.title: Exchange Data
exchange.description: Provides exchange information including PRUNplanner calculated averages (PP7D, PP30D) as well as ingame data.

material.title: Material Data
material.description: Provides data on all Prosperous Universe materials including their ticker, weight and volume.

material_io.title: Material I/O
material_io.description: Provides your plans Material I/O information, data is refreshed every plan calculation save.

auth.error_login: Login failed. Please check your username and password.
auth.tos_prefix: By using PRUNplanner you agree to the
auth.register_success_desc: Your account has been created successfully. You can now log into PRUNplanner.
auth.register_tos_desc: PRUNplanner is free to use. By creating an account you confirm and agree to the
auth.username_info: Must have at least 3 characters. Cannot contain spaces.
auth.email_info: Not required. Adds security to your account.
auth.security_question_desc: Please enter the name of planet {planet}. To find it, open a new buffer in Prosperous Universe using the command {command}. You will find the planet's name under "Name" in the planet information.

version_update.click_to_load: Click to load the newest version.

help.title: Help
help.heading: Help & Changelog
help.contribution_text: PRUNplanner's frontend is open source and contributions are welcome on GitHub!

tutorial.intro: PRUNplanner helps you design bases, organize empires, and calculate profits — without wasting in-game resources. It mirrors nearly every aspect of Prosperous Universe so you can plan smarter and play more confidently.

getting_started.title: Getting Started
getting_started.step1: Create an Empire in Management: By default, you'll already have one. But you can add more for different factions or regions. Assign a name and faction, and save.
getting_started.step2: Set up an Exchange: Go into Management and create your exchange. Switch to the Exchanges view to modify it. For most players, set it to Both (buying and selling) and choose the exchange your bases will use (e.g., CI1 for Benten). Save it.
getting_started.step3: Search for a Planet: Use the planet search to filter by resources, programs, or proximity to a CX. Select your target planet and view its modifiers, extraction rates, and infrastructure.
getting_started.step4: Create a Plan: Choose your Empire, give it a name, then add buildings. For example: add a Refinery, set a production order, and save the plan. You can modify all aspects like COGC, expert bonuses and dive into optimizations.
getting_started.step5: Check ROI: Once set up, you'll see daily profits, inputs and outputs, and return on investment for each production line. Adjust, experiment, and optimize.

plans.title: Plans
plans.desc: A plan represents a single base: its buildings, productions, and bonuses. Create a plan by choosing a planet, placing buildings, and assigning it to an Empire with a CX preference.

empires.title: Empires
empires.desc: An Empire is a container of multiple plans — essentially your entire network of bases. Empires keep your supply chains organized and allow you to manage multiple bases together.

exchanges.title: Exchanges
exchanges.desc: Exchange settings define how prices are calculated. Each Empire uses one Exchange for consistency. You can reuse the same Exchange setup across empires if needed.

base_simulation.title: Base Simulation
base_simulation.desc: Design and test bases without spending resources. From habitation to production to planet-specific modifiers and bonuses — PRUNplanner simulates it all.

empire_planning.title: Empire Planning
empire_planning.desc: Manage your empire across multiple bases and supply chains. Keep your materials flowing, prevent bottlenecks, and run smoothly at scale. Always see what is going on and where the next best expansion starts.

game_data.title: Game Data
game_data.desc: Market information is integrated directly from FIO, the community API. Plan expansions, check ROI, and make informed trade decisions. Explore historic market data or let PRUNplanner calculate production or resource extraction ROIs.

burn_repair.title: Burn & Repair
burn_repair.desc: Track consumables and building wear. Avoid shortages and downtime by seeing exactly what your colony needs and when it needs it.

additional_tools.title: A Wealth of Additional Tools
additional_tools.desc: Dive into historical prices, optimize habitation layouts, estimate visitation frequencies, and fine-tune production efficiency. PRUNplanner is packed with utilities to give you the edge.

sharing.title: Share Plan
sharing.create_info: This will create an unique link that can be shared with others. They will be able to see your plan, but don't modify it. The link becomes unavailable once you choose to stop sharing or delete the plan.
sharing.active_info: You're currently sharing this plan. It has been viewed {count} times.

empires.heading: Empire Configurations
empires.info_text: Deleting an empire will not delete any associated plans - they will become unassigned. You can edit existing empires in the empire view. To ensure accurate plan efficiency calculations, make sure each empire has the correct faction and permits set.

delete_confirm.title: Confirm Empire Deletion
delete_confirm.content: Are you sure? Deleting an empire will not delete assigned plans.

exchanges.heading: Exchange Configurations
exchanges.title: Exchanges
exchanges.info_text: Deleting an exchange preference will delete all its exchange and material settings. Assigned empires will not be affected but they will no longer use the deleted preference. Make sure to assign a new exchange preference.
exchanges.no_preferences_text: You do not have any exchange preferences yet. Head over to the management page to create your first preference.

delete_confirm.title: Confirm Exchange Preference Deletion
delete_confirm.content: Are you sure? Deleting an exchange will delete all preferences.

assignments.heading: Plan ↔ Empire Assignments
assignments.info_text: Each planned base can be assigned to multiple empires. This allows you to track your current Prosperous Universe empire, corporation chains, or future expansion plans simultaneously.

table.create_first: Use the planet search to create your first plan.

delete_confirm.title: Confirm Plan Deletion
delete_confirm.content: Are you sure? Plans cannot be recovered once deleted.
